page.title: 12HORTICULTURE/SILVICULTURE
page.content: There are four main nurseries in the area:Mosslane(952366),Spot Acre(950373) ,Fulford(949376),Moddershall(925365). They are located here for physical and economic reasons.The nurseries,despite their high elevation(200m average) take advantage of south facing slopes which avoid excessive frost damage by air drainage.Economically they are well situated for the urban markets of the Midlands. The trees grown by the majority of the nurseries are used by local councils for landscaping purposes.The local demand for more gardening equipment and plants, has increased rapidly in past years partly due to more and more leisure time available to the working population.In the 60's and 70's the size and numbers of nurseries increased due to the new demand for trees for pottery land reclamation.
